revised_title: The Chemical Basis of Flower Color: Ivory and Yellow in Antirrhinum
tldr: The authors investigate the chemical basis of flower color in Antirrhinum plants, specifically the ivory and yellow varieties. They identify the ivory pigment as apigenin, a flavone, and the yellow pigment as luteolin. The factorial difference between the two varieties lies in their ability to produce these pigments; the ivory variety forms apigenin throughout the flower, while the yellow variety forms luteolin in the upper epidermis of the lips.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
